plants.name: Cypripedium calceolus
plants.description: A striking wild orchid known for its unique slipper-shaped yellow pouch and mottled leaves. It typically grows in temperate European woodlands.
plants.funFact: The Lady's Slipper Orchid traps insects temporarily in its pouch to aid in pollination.

plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: A popular cultivated autumn-blooming plant often used in floral displays, known for its dense, pompom-like flowers and variety of colors.
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are symbolic of autumn in many cultures and are the flower emblem of Japan.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree with bright orange to yellow spider-like flowers that provide nectar for birds.
plants.funFact: Silky Oak wood is prized for its attractive grain and used in furniture making.

plants.name: Aster novae-angliae
plants.description: A wildflower native to North America, known for its vibrant purple daisy-like flowers with yellow centers, blooming late into autumn.
plants.funFact: New England Asters attract butterflies and are important late-season nectar sources.
